elevatorPitch.title: My role
pitch: As a product owner, my mission is to deliver a great product to the user, to commit developers to technological excellence, to ensure designs respect technical constraints, to enable the company to understand what it is we are building, and to ensure our representatives are heard. As a manager, I believe that working software is the primary measure of success, that maximizing the amount of work not done is essential and that business people and developers must work together daily throughout the project.

projects.name: Fuzzy Roadmap
description: This easy to use tool will enable you to create fuzzy time roadmap in a matter of seconds, available today at fuzzyroadmap.com. Fuzzy time roadmaps are tools that will let your main stakeholder keep an eye on what is currently being worked on as well as to know what is next. That being said, they fully embrace development uncertainties, especially time since you do don't give any estimate or timeline. Usually, you will want to report on four basic timelines: in progress, soon, later, done.

projects.name: Day2Day.wallpaper
description: Chrome OS is an amazing OS but its wallpaper management abilities are lacking, at best. Day2Day.wallpaper enable its users browse, discover and find amazing photos to use as their new wallpaper for their Chrome OS devices.

projects.name: Day2Day.password
description: Day2Day password is a Chrome extension that enables its users to create strong password on the fly. This encourages you to use unique and strong password on each service you create an account for.

projects.name: Day2Day
description: Day2Day is a Chrome extension for people who want to get more out of their days. It acts as a new homepage and provides you with a todo list, a notepad and access to your Pocket read list. It does that and displays amazing pictures from Unsplash as well as the weather to make sure you can truely get it all done in one place.

testimonials.quote: Adrien is an awesome person to work with. While we were at Jogogo, he consistently demonstrated a solid work ethic plus a dedication for success. He is what I would call a natural born Product Owner. He embraces the product vision and have great understanding of the market in which the product evolves. He shows great leadership and is always looking for the greater good of his team & product.

I had the immense pleasure of working with Adrien for almost two years, and never once did he fail to impress me with his great attention to detail, rigorousness and brilliancy which made him a reference for everyone working with him. He can adapt, improvise and overcome any problem

I had the pleasure to collaborate with Adrien on several projects at Valtech on which I am the Account Director. Adrien is a very organized product owner and has the ability to vulgarize complex technical aspects of a project to our clients and colleagues. He is also really pleasant to work with from a human perspective. Adrien is the type of expert you wish to work with and have in your team!

work.name: Product owner
description: Valtech is a global business transformation agency delivering innovation with a purpose.

At Valtech, I operated as a Product Owner and was in charge of projects ranging from dig data for Pratt & Whitney, to eCommerce for Tiffany and even virtual events for Uni-Select and much more. My day to day was very much about taking an idea and making it a reality, fixing and planning ahead of the many issues that regularly block development.

This being said, as a web wizard, I was able to actively come in and help my teams by producing designs, code, data analysis, client management and of course, the mandatory backlog and roadmap management.

work.name: Product owner
description: Jogogo is a physical space analytics tool that lets its users track and engage their visitors based on their activity. I was the Product Owner for both the App and the API and implemented a SCRUM process that enabled us to complete the redesigns of both our App (React) and our API (GraphQL). Both of the APP and API were used by enterprise clients such as Decathlon, Desjardins, Asmodee, Telus, IBM and Cisco.
work.appraisal: When I arrived, the team had no development method, the deadlines were systematically exceeded and the other teams complained of a lack of visibility regarding the new features. Today, the Jogogo App & API team has become an example for other teams in terms of its organization and productivity. These organizational changes allowed the team to deploy many ambitious features, including a public API (GraphQL) as well as a technical rewrite of the front-end (React). It should be noted that the users' NPR has increased as the new methodology has been implemented.
work.context: Intervention at Jogogo as product owner within the App and API team. My role was to structure the team in order to increase productivity, visibility with other teams as well as allow the recruitment of new members.
results: Organization and animation of retrospectives, daily meeting, Poker planning, sprint planning
Implementation of guidelines development and code review
Backlog management and roadmap monitoring (fuzzy time roadmap)
Writing user stories / functional and technical specifications
Implementation of a design system and production of prototypes
Design & deployment of a home made WiFi sniffer

I acted as Product Owner for our website and tools and led a team of twenty people through a technological redesign of our websites and internal tools (ASP.NET and Kentico). I also oversaw and participated in the visual redesign of the website.
work.appraisal: My mission was to allow the transmission and documentation of knowledge from an outgoing team as well as to structure two new groups through an agile reorganization.
